crazy good for a mobile game- eh?

Oh, there it is, at the top, lol
is good game- just dont spend money on it at all- or at least dont buy gems
the wish rates for the gacha system are insane and you can earn free rolls
Well, if it's a FTP game, I should spend money *somewhere* if I plan on playing long term
average cost of a 5 Star Character is 250USD
Ngl, I'm still kinda bummed I never spent money on Apex Legends, haha
But... I just can't get behind battle passes
Meh, I had that problem when Destiny started messing with their Season passes...
But battle passes, at their core, are you paying for the ability to earn limited time rewards.  But if you don't earn them, oh well, thanks for the money!
I thought I was, until they changed it, and I found out I was not...
About the same with the Season passes, you buy one and get access to that season's content, but it expire at the end of the season, so if you haven't completed it, its your loss
hoi hoi! ooh, Destiny! I can't say I've played it myself, but I do like the graphics
It's crazy... the more I find games trying to twist your arm into playing them, the more I'm turned off...

in Genshin Impact the Battlepass has a free version, an extra set of rewards if you pay, and you can pay for a +10 boost to the level- and can spend gems to level too- so its a decent mix but still- you can sink money in it hard XD
Like, Apex Legends has some *amazing* cosmetics, but so many of them were tied to the battle pass.
Destiny was more or less the only game I played for years, until they change the seasons and made expiring content
I play too little to be able to take full advantage of it, and without season pass there's not enough new to keep me going
The game's industry has hit a dark place for sure
I'm a lousy customer, once I've bought a game I "never" spend money on it...
Imo, if you pay for a pass, you should be able to finish it, period.
The fact that they time gate something you BUY is a hard pass from me
A misguided belief that everything you earn should be achieved through the game, not by throwing extra money at it...
it sounds weird, but I much prefer to have physical games and not really digital....I'm not much of an online player unfortunately
my issue has been how easy it is to buy games I want to play on Steam/Switch. Then be really lazy about going and playing them
Agreed Noodle, and with the DLC there came out this week they REMOVED a lot of the original content... in the game I paid for...
I wish more unlockables were earned instead of bought....I'm a bit old school in that regard
I dont mind micropayments and similar if its just cosmetics and similar, but once you start paying for upgrades that gives you an advantage gamingvise against others, I'm out...
I remember playing the online game of Travian years ago, and at one point I was around at reset where everyone started all over
After three days of play I had my stockade up around my village and had a decent set of soldiers and I was satisfied with my progress
... then I looked around and found a player who already had three towns, almost fully updgraded, and was already sending full armies out to trash any player who dared starting up close to him...
.. guess who just sunk a whole bunch of monnies into fast upgrades and diamonds...
that...makes it less fun imo....challenges are part of the fun
I like working my way up, but it should be equal playing field
When you can buy you out of challenges or to serious advantages over others in the game?
ooh, being able to instantly upgrade without any challenges to build up. working your way through the game is better than instantly or easily defeating others....to me at least
Battlefront nearly DIED over the gambling pay-to-win nature of the game

the buying mechanic includes using in game currency that you earn- so its for people who dont have time to finish something before a deadline if they cant complete all the tasks due to - you know- life
its also optional to spend money so it doesnt take anything from it if you can
Sounds like Genshin Impact nailed a good balance between its FTP and Microtransactions
I dont belittle people spending money to catch up or, as you mention, to finish something off, but when you can use them to get majorly ahead...
Too many games are egregiously greedy and make the game such a slog without throwing money at it
Y'all hear about that Harry Potter mobile game?
using them to get majorly ahead is my biggest issue...it's something I see a lot of nowadays
i heard of it, but nothing other than that
but it doesnt get you ahead
it gives you less to do in the game
pay to win is blegh, pay to save time seems alright, as long as it's an optional thing. think I'm agreeing with y'all

UNTIL you reach the bloody Devil's Snare...
